availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert Armstrong Athey (Kenton County, lawyer, asst. adjutant general for KY vols (U.S.A.))

body.p: Kenton County, Kentucky, lawyer and Assistant Adjutant General of the Kentucky Volunteers. Kentucky native.Married to Elizabeth Athey. Married to Kate Stephens Athey on January 17, 1865 in Kenton County, Kentucky. Lawyer in Kenton County, Kentucky in 1860. Served as major and Assistant Adjutant General for the Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) until August 31, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Find A Grave, "Judge Robert Armstrong Athey (1825-1901)," Memorial #89872523, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/89872523 (accessed July 10, 2019).
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton, Covington Ward 1, p. 530.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Kenton County Marriages, Film #001943299.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), VII.
